document.docAuthor: Jiang, Chunyan, Caldara, Roberto & Zhang, Runzhi
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Tychius Germar (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Curculioninae) in China, with description of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Tychius Germar (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Curculioninae) in China, with description of three new species

Remarks and comparative notes. This species was placed in a monobasic group by Caldara (1990) based on the shape of the male genitalia, mainly due to the uncommonly long apophysis of the penis and the spermatheca possessing indistinct ramus and collum. It seems to be one of the most common species in the oriental Palearctic countries, where it is easily distinguishable from the other species by its small size, notwithstanding genitalia, combined with the pattern of the elytral vestiture.

Distribution. Widely distributed throughout eastern Asia (Siberia, Mongolia , Korea , Japan ) including China (FUJ GUX HEB SHX TIA); new records from Northeast China (HEI JIL NMO), North China (BEI), East China (JIX), Central China (HUN) and Northwest China (SHA).
